project-challenges: I originally chose SimpleDB as a data source and a synchronous callback system. This worked until things got a bit slower and I started bumping up against the limits of the 3 second cutoff time for Slack responses.
project-future-plans: UX improvements, better finishing scripts, S3 bucket uploads of results!
project-purpose: It steps a group of users through a basic retrospective with voting support via native Slack emoji responses.
project-inspiration: I love the concept of the Agile Retrospective but it can be difficult to get everyone together. I built this bot so I could better collaborate with teams and I love the concept of serverless architecture.
project-lessons-learned: This was one of my first big foreys into the AWS world and I think I'm in love with serverless arch.
project-accomplishments: I'm proud that I managed to implement a manual infrastructure script as it now feels like I have a much better handle on API Gateway and IAM internals. At the last minute I ripped out SimpleDB and implemented DynamoDB and an SNS pub/sub queue for invoking my lambda!
project-subtitle: A bot that lets you remotely do retros in Slack!
